concept.name: grid-template-areas
concept.explain: Name layout slots in .grid and place .car with grid-area using the named slot.

ui.prompt: Define template areas so the named area park lands at column 3, row 2.
hints: Use a 5-line grid-template-areas map with one park token.

entities.baseCss: background: rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.22); outline: 2px dashed rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.8); border-radius: 10px;

concept.name: repeating area names
concept.explain: Repeat the same area name across adjacent cells to create a spanning area.

ui.prompt: Define a 2-column-wide park area on row 3 so the car spans columns 2 to 4.
hints: Put park park on row 3, columns 2 and 3.
Other cells in the map should be .

entities.baseCss: background: rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.22); outline: 2px dashed rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.8); border-radius: 10px;

concept.name: rectangular named area
concept.explain: To create a 2×2 named area, repeat the same name across two columns and two rows.

ui.prompt: Define park as a 2×2 area at columns 4 to 6 and rows 2 to 4.
hints: Place park park on row 2 and row 3, columns 4 and 5.
Keep all other area slots as .

entities.baseCss: background: rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.22); outline: 2px dashed rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.8); border-radius: 10px;
